name: Rosewood Hotel Georgia

reviews.text: I have been visiting the Hotel Georgia since I was a little girl and had my 19th birthday there long befor it was closed for renovations. I have been looking forward to the re-opening for a long time and was very excited to see that I could stay here this time I was passing through Vancouver. Seeing as you get you're 3rd night free right now it makes staying that much more awesome. Check in, is a breeze. The bellman was very friendly and helpful making sure to explain how all the lighting and tv works. About 10 minutes after checkin they will call to make sure you are satisfied with everything in your room. I was on the 7th floor facing the art gallery. For some people you may find it a bit noisy, however city noise doesnt bother me.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view was lovely. The room itself is lovely. The bathroom is FANTASTIC!! And in all honesty the bed is THE MOST comfortable bed I have ever had the pleasure to sleep on. Truly fantastic! The pool is beautiful and although I didnt use the fitness room it looked great as well. I had breakfast twice and dinner once from roomservice. Again it was fantastic. Great service and great food. Hawksworth's is definatly worth a visit. I went for dinner. My server was efficient, knowlegable, not pretentious, and didnt hover and wasnt overly flamboyant which is what I prefer. To say the food was fantastic is an understatment. The drinks were amazing! Wow! Try a mint julep! Also the lobby bar is a nice place to have a quick bite and a refreshing drink if you have been out enjoying the city.
reviews.title: We will be back! AMAZING!!! hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last time I was in Vancouver I stayed at Shangrila. In my opinion the Hotel Georgia is the BEST place to stay in Vancouver. I will not stay anywhere else in future visits to the city. If you are thinking of booking for a special occasion. Dont hesitate! You wont be dissapointed :)
reviews.title: It can't possibly get any better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walking into this hotel was just magical. A lovely gentleman named Brian greeted us at the door, and we have never felt so welcome in a hotel establishment. They have managed to create an oasis of quiet, beauty, cleanliness, aesthetic sophistication, and luxury. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the entire hotel smells fresh and sweet. The maids came by twice daily, and our lady even thoughtfully placed our books on the bed when she turned it down, leaving the lights dimmed and shortbread cookies and water by the bedside with our slippers. We felt like royalty returning to our palace at the end of each evening.
reviews.title: Dreamy hotel, attention to detail and staff top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff of this hotel is just AMAZING, and the staff at the Concierge (Heather, Connie and Rob to name a few) desk made our trip ever more delightful with helpful recommendations... Jim is such a lovely sweet guy - you will find out who he is when you stay at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia.
reviews.title: A superb hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed in both a Junior and 1 bedroom suite. The rooms were spacious and loaded with amenities! Enormous tub, heated bath floors and the largest shower ever. The Jr suite was an interior courtyard room and proved to be quieter than the corner suite. The one bedroom suite was situated on the corner of the intersection, offering plenty of light with large windows on both exterior walls. The separate bedroom with desk and sitting area, extra bath, pantry, dining area and living room all proved the 1 bedroom to be functional, comfortable and welcoming. Mesmerizing views of the city lights and historic architecture across the way. Service - warm and welcoming throughout! Always friendly, efficient and informative. Hotel car was uber-convenient and the driver = what a gem! The fine details everywhere on the property made this trip spectacular. Wish we were in Vancouver more often.
reviews.title: Exceptional in every way !

reviews.text: I had the pleasure to stay at Rosewood Hotel Georgia. What an amazing Hotel. The staff was so service minded, I stayed in a Deluxe Room and had the best bath ever! I was attending a meeting. Banquet staff was very attentive and the food was great. I loved the natural light in the meeting space.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience!

reviews.text: Thank you Rosewood Hotel Georiga for a great stay and for making our meeting a sucess.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Vancouver....by far

reviews.text: I am fortunate enough to have stayed in some of Vancouver's best hotels. Over the years I have travelled to Vancouver and stayed at the likes of the Opus, Four Seasons, Fairmont, Loden, Shangri-La...and now The Georgia.
reviews.title: Little piece of heaven right in Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The compliments are going to come at you thick and fast: from the incredible staff (big shout out to Rob on the concierge desk); to the complimentary Bentley drive, and Jim, the quintessential Gentleman, who kindly drove me to Yaletown.
reviews.title: Delighted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Hotel Georgia. The building and finishes are beautiful. Every staff member we encountered from concierge to housekeeper had a genuine interest in making our stay an enjoyable one.
reviews.title: Wonderful surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt absolutely pampered. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable with luxurious linens. The bathroom felt like a spa with heated marble floors, fluffy towels and cozy robes. The espresso machine was sweet as were the shortbread cookies with the turn down service. We also took advantage of the stunning saltwater pool and the complimentary car service (nice Bentley!)
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, based on the outstanding service alone.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really can't describe how much we loved this hotel (but I'll try!) We've been back home for nearly a week now and we still can't stop talking about it. There were so many luxurious details, which - combined with the outstanding customer service - all added up to a feeling of having been totally pampered. It's one of the few hotels where I can honestly say the room looked as beautiful as the glossy official website photos. All the staff were excellent and the downtown location was central, yet we didn't notice any excessive street noise (we were on floor 7). The attention to detail that has obviously gone into recreating the ambience of the original hotel really works. The bed was so comfortable, the turn-down service included several thoughtful little touches, the heated floor in the bathroom was great and the rainforest shower was amazing. We decided to have breakfast in the Hawksworth restaurant one morning and it was delicious, again with impeccable service. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to treat themselves to a luxurious hotel experience at a non-outlandish price.
reviews.title: Perfect, luxurious, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Having stayed at many of the 5 star hotels in Vancouver this is BY FAR the absolute most luxurious!!!!
reviews.title: VANCOUVER'S BEST HOTEL

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for a week while in transition between moves. The best decision I made to stay in this recently renovated classic hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Check in was painless and fast. My room was exactly what I needed while being between two homes. It gave me a feel of not being uprooted, very important when one goes through a major move. Even though I live in Vancouver, I'd come and stay here again to get a mini vacation.
reviews.title: In the heart of the city - a little oasis

reviews.text: Just got back from a glorious two night stay at the Hotel Georgia. This hotel is impeccable!! I used to live in Vancouver and was always sad to see them tear down the old buildings downtown to replace them with glass and steel. So to walk in to the lobby of this hotel and see the beautiful restoration was wonderful. Old world charm meets modern day luxury. The attention to detail is amazing. Everything has been planned with the comfort of the guest in mind. The rooms are spacious and soooooo soothing. The luxurious bathroom with its heated floors, stand alone tub and glass walled rainshower is bigger than some hotel rooms I have stayed in. The service absolutely exceeded my expectations. Warm and genuine from everyone I encountered. I cannot remember when I felt so valued as a customer. The bar off the restaurant and the coffee shop are both great places to have a drink and people watch. They both attract a lot of locals and have a great vibe. I didn't get to experience the restaurant but local friends tell me the food is very good. For me this is the best location in Vancouver. Close to absolutely everything. For a medium budget I still love the St Regis. It offers great value for the price. But if you are looking for luxury you will find nothing better in Vancouver than the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. Worth every single cent!!!
reviews.title: Luxury at its finest!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for two nights on the 14th and 15th january. check in was really smooth and fast, our room was just gorgeous - a decent size with a wonderful, really luxurious bathroom. the bed was a king size and was extremely comfortable but the pillows were magnificent! we didnt eat at the hotel but asked the concierge for advice. Connie was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and sent us to the Cafe Medina for breakfast which was great. we each had a massage. the spa area is very good and our masseure, Chito, was the best we have ever come across. none of this stroking and poking but a properly trained, knew what she was about, masseure. make sure you use the complimentary stretch Bentley which will take you about the downtown area. Jim the driver was great. My only complaint is that they charged to use Wifi. with the sort of prices you pay for staying this was a bit mean. having said that i would make this our hotel of choice and wouldnt even try any of the others because i dont believe they could top the Georgia.
reviews.title: fabulous hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the newly renovated Rosewood Hotel Georgia from January 12-15th (today!) for a weekend get away. What an amazing experience!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: - Our check in was flawless. Even though we arrived at almost 1am, Navi (sp? at the front desk) and Steven (at the bell desk) were extremely helpful. Navi recommended that we upgrade to a junior suite (for $25 per night extra, what a steal!). Steven gave us a tour of the room (heated granite floors in the restroom, amazing!).
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: As other reviewers have eloquently stated, the Rosewood Hotel Georgia is indeed special and its list of outstanding qualities quite long. The restoration of a heritage building has been gorgeously executed, both in public areas and the rooms themselves. At every turn one finds a fixture, texture, or material of interest or an appreciated touch of luxury. From Hawksworth restaurant to the salt-water pool, every touch is artfully presented, and the room, bed, and bath are truly top-drawer.
reviews.title: The Absolute Apex of Hospitality

reviews.text: As much as I love the property, service is the element that places the Hotel Georgia in a league of its own. Everyone is warm, caring, sophisticated, truly kind, and so very good at what they do, as evidenced by:
reviews.title: A great addition to the Rosewood brand.

reviews.text: *A U.S. customs and immigration form sent to my room the evening before departure by Connie from concierge services. First time any hotel has ever had that level of forethought and attention to detail and I travel internationally many times a year.
reviews.title: Profoundly wonder*full

reviews.text: *On the morning of checkout, my excellent housekeeper who kept the room spotless, calls me by name and shared that she hoped I had enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: A modern Treasure

reviews.text: *Jim will put you in the Bentley saloon and truly transport you to a different place. He is gifted and passionate and the moments whiling away with him are truly special.
reviews.title: Absolutely the Best - and I've seen them all

reviews.text: Just returned from an incredible stay at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. Can't say enough about the service. We stayed for 3 nights (got the three for two deal) following my husbands surgery. Every step of the way, they went out of their way to accomodate our needs. Those little things like remembering our names as we stepped off the elevator and greeting us with a smile. Any question or request we had they were more than helpful to accomodate. The room service was quick and professional- food was delicious. Every member of their staff treated us as if they were there for us. The bed was very comfortable and evening turn down service with cookies, ice and bottled water was an added bonus. The hotel is in the heart of the city with Pacific Centre Mall right across the street. If you like to be pampered- this is the place.
reviews.title: This place is all about its customers!

reviews.text: A perfect hotel... 3 nights (for the price of 2,so an absolute bargain)
reviews.title: Smelling of roses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hits -, huge comfortable beds with lovely sheets ,Jimmy the Bentley driver, lovely pool with excellent gym, biscuits at bedtime, fabulous artwork in the foyer
reviews.title: One of the Finest Hotels in North America

reviews.text: Misses-none
reviews.title: A superb stay

reviews.text: Perfect on all accounts. We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Georgia in November 2011, and would recommend the hotel to anyone and everyone. Hotel is essentially brand new after a 4 year renovation. No expense was spared. Rooms are fantastic. And the bathrooms even better. Luxury everywhere. Hotel staff was some of the most helpful I have ever encountered. Imagine being driven to your evening dinner in the hotel's own Bentley! Hotel restaurant one of the best in the city too. Spa is great. Exercise facility top notch. Indoor Pool amazing! Perfect location for seeing Vancouver. 5 Star rating is not high enough! HM
reviews.title: The Rosewood Georgia is top notch, the very best stay we've ever had!

reviews.text: I spent 3 days and 2 nights at the Rosewood in Oct 2011. Upon check-in I received a complimentary room upgraded so I had the pleasure of enjoying more space (and bathrooms) than any one person really needs. My bed was lush and cushy and the furniture was surprisingly comfortable for a hotel. Both of the bathrooms were lovely, there was a slight echo in the shower, but since I don't normally talk to myself in the shower it wasn't a big deal :P My favourite features of the room included the espresso machine and the bathtub.
reviews.title: Excellence and Beauty. Perfect Combo.

reviews.text: I was travelling for busines and was hosting an event in their Spanish Ballroom. The event space was beautiful. The catering was yummy. The staff were friendly and most accomodating with every single wish and whim. Vijay and his team are, in a word, Awesome.
reviews.title: Simply Sublime...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my stay I also attended a private reception and enjoyed a tour of the newly renovated hotel. After seeing each type of room, including the gorgeous penthouse suites I can honestly say that the Rosewood is absolutely lovely, top to bottom. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly an amazing experience. As I turned each corner in the suite I was thoroughly impressed. I kept saying over and over again.. they have thought of everything. If you want to treat yourself to a wonderful Vancouver hotel experience - this is it! Elegant, modern and beautiful. I was equally impressed that the older structural elements were maintained on the property. They have been incorporated so gracefully with the modern decor and amenities. Thank you Rosewood... I can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Superb service and ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a weekend here with my husband after a week of skiing in Whistler. Excellent friendly, attentive and personal service from the moment you pull up at the front door. James, who showed us to the room made sure to settle us in comfortably and brought us up a pot of tea right away. The staff greets you by name every time they see you and is always ready to help. The room was very comfortable and had luxe decor but a bit small and not much closet/storage space but this was well compensated by a lovely big bathroom with heated marble floors and a roomy bathtub, (great to soak the aching post skiing muscles in) and a fabulously comfortable bed. Location couldn't have been more convenient- all the shops, bars, restaurants are a stones throw away. Complimentary Bentley hotel car service within downtown with an extremely friendly and warm driver Jim was a nice touch. Valet service always had our rental car ready by the door and stocked with fresh bottled water before we stepped out The pool and spa looked great. Everything in this hotel is new, polished and clean but with just the right touch of old school glamour and luxury. Highly recommended. This hotel lives up to all its great reviews.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in downtown Vancouver!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent some time narrowing down Vancouver BC hotels to make sure we got the 'perfect' one for a long anniversary weekend, and we did good in choosing the Hotel Georgia! From the moment we arrived they treated us with excellence. We were extremely delighted with our room, the staff, the location, the quiet, the amenities.... and the gym is the best I've seen. We rode to dinner in the hotel's Bentley, and they promptly picked us up when we were done. They knew our names by the time we got back from dinner. Each person we interacted with was completely professional and genuine. You could tell they staff enjoyed working there.
reviews.title: Anniversary Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located right at the center of downtown, yet just far enough off the beaten path I didn't feel like we were in a high traffic zone. Robson is 1 block away, and Gastown is about 5 blocks the other direction. We didn't use our car at all for 2 days.
reviews.title: Old School Elegance

reviews.text: This was by far one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in - including ours at home.
reviews.title: Amazing property

reviews.text: It is a new hotel, and the outdoor fire-pit area is not complete yet but we will be back soon to enjoy that as well!
reviews.title: Top hotel in Vancouver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I HAD to say something negative I would say I wish there was a hot tub... but the tub in our room was so nice we really didn't need one!
reviews.title: Incredible Staff, incredible experience.

description: Following its debut in the Roaring ‘20s, the Hotel Georgia came to be known as Vancouver’s most historic and elegant retreat. The opening of Rosewood Hotel Georgia in 2011 has returned Vancouver's most legendary hotel to its place as one of the select hotels worldwide. The hotel reflects timeless elegance, with 156 luxurious guestrooms and suites, Sense, A Rosewood Spa®, Reflections outdoor patio, 1927 Lobby Lounge, 9853 sq feet of function space, a fitness center, 52” indoor saltwater lap pool and Hawksworth restaurant.
